Field1.Field_Description: SPI Read 0 = SPI Read is disabled 1 = SPI Read is enabled

Field2.Field_Description: Timer Counter Reset 0 = Disables timer counter reset, required for normal timer operation 1 = Timer counters are in reset state

Field3.Field_Description: Diagnostic Enable 0 = No Action 1= Diagnostic mode is enabled & the diagnostics sequence starts when this bit is set. At the end of the sequence, the status of the faults are stored in the register Diagnostics Flags<23:0>. After this, the DIAG_EN register bit self clears to 0.

Field4.Field_Description: Software Reset 0 = No Action 1 = Software reset applied – resets all internal registers to their default values and self-clears to 0

Field1.Field_Description: Sample LED2 Start count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the “Sample LED2” signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Sample LED2 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of "Sample LED2" signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED2 LED Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED2 LED with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED2 LED End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED2 LED signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED2 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the Sample Ambient (LDE2) with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED2 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the Sample Ambient (LED2) signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the Sample LED1 signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the Sample LED1 signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 LED Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED1 LED signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 LED End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED1 LED signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED1 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the Sample Ambient (LED1) signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED1 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the Sample Ambient (LED1) signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED2 Convert Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED2 conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED2 Convert End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED2 conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED2 Convert Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED2 ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED2 Convert End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED2 ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 Convert Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED1 ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

LED1 Convert End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED1 ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED1 Convert Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the start of the LED1 Ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP, specified in register 29). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value

Ambient LED1 Convert End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the end of the LED1 Ambient conversion signal with respect to the pulse repetition period (PRP). It is specified as the number of 4Mhz clock cycles. Minimum value = 0x0000, maximum value <= PRP value
ADC Reset 0 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the Start of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 0 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the End of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 1 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the Start of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 1 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the End of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 2 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the Start of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 2 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the End of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 3 Start Count The contents of this register can be used to position the Start of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
ADC Reset 3 End Count The contents of this register can be used to position the End of the ADC Reset conversion signal.
Pulse Repetition Count The contents of this register can be used to set the pulse repetition period (in number of clock cycles of the 4MHz clock). Maximum value = 0xFFFF.
Number of Averages Specify an 8-bit value that corresponds to the (number of ADC samples to be averaged -1) For example, to average four ADC samples, set Number of Averages<7:0> = 3

Field2.Field_Description: Timer Enable 0 = Timer module is disabled & all internal clocks are off. 1 = Timer module is enabled

Field3.Field_Description:
Clocks on Alarm Pins Internal clocks can be brought to PD_ALM & LED_ALM pins for monitoring Note that register bit <En Clocks on ALM> must be set before using this. Clocks on ALM Signal on Signal on pins<2:0> PD_ALM pin LED_ALM pin
000 Sample LED2 pulse Sample LED1 pulse 001 LED2 LED pulse LED1 LED pulse 010 Sample LED2 Ambient Sample LED1 Ambient pulse 011 LED2 Convert LED1 Convert 100 LED2 Ambient Convert LED1 Ambient Convert 101 No output No output 110 No output No output 111 No output No output

Field1.Field_Description: Must always be set to ‘0’
Program the value of RF for LED1 000 = 500k Ohms 001 = 250k Ohms 010 = 100k Ohms 011 = 50k Ohms 100 = 25k Ohms 101 = 10k Ohms 110 = 1M Ohms 111 = None

Field2.Field_Description: Program the value of CF for LED1 00000 = 5pF (default value after reset) 00001 = 5pF + 5 pF 0010 = 15pF + 5pF 00100 = 25pF + 5pF 01000 = 50pF + 5pF 10000 = 150pF + 5pF Note that any combination of above Cf is also supported by setting multiple bits to 1. For example, to get Cf=100pf, set D7-D3 = 01111

Field3.Field_Description: Program Stage 2 gain for LED1 000 = 0 dB, or linear gain of 1 (default after reset) 001 = 3.5 dB, or linear gain of 1.5 010 = 6 dB, or linear gain of 2 011 = 9.5 dB, or linear gain of 3 100 = 12 dB, or linear gain of 4 101 = Do not use 110 = Do not use 111 = Do not use

Field4.Field_Description: Enable Stage 2 for LED 1 0 = Stage 2 is bypassed (default after reset) 1 = Stage 2 is enabled with the gain value specified by the STG2GAIN1[2:0] bits

Field5.Field_Description: Enable Separate Gain Modes 0 = The value of both Rf and Cfis same for both LED2 & LED1 signals, value specified by register bits Program RF for LED2<2:0> is used. 1 = The Rf value is different for the LED2 & LED1 signals, values are specified by register bits Program RF for LED1<2:0> & Program RF for LED2<2:0>

Field1.Field_Description: Program the value of RF for LED2 000 = 500k Ohms 001 = 250k Ohms 010 = 100k Ohms 011 = 50k Ohms 100 = 25k Ohms 101 = 10k Ohms 110 = 1M Ohms 111 = None

Field2.Field_Description: Program the value of CF for LED2 00000 = 5pF (default value after reset) 00001 = 5pF + 5 pF 0010 = 15pF + 5pF 00100 = 25pF + 5pF 01000 = 50pF + 5pF 10000 = 150pF + 5pF Note that any combination of above Cf is also supported by setting multiple bits to 1. For example, to get Cf=100pf, set D7-D3 = 01111

Field3.Field_Description: Stage 2 gain setting for LED 2 000 = 0 dB (or linear gain of 1) 001 = 3 dB (or linear gain of 1.414) 010 = 6 dB (or linear gain of 2) 011 = 9 dB (or linear gain of 2.818) 100 = 12 dB (or linear gain of 4) 101 = Do Not Use 110 = Do Not Use 111 = Do Not Use

Field4.Field_Description: Stage 2 enable for LED 2 0 = Stage 2 is bypassed (default after reset) 1 = Stage 2 is enabled with the gain value specified by the STG2GAIN2[2:0] bits

Field5.Field_Description: Filter Corner Select 0 = 500 Hz filter corner 1 = 1000 Hz filter corner

Field6.Field_Description: Ambient DAC Value - Sets the Value of the Cancellation Current 0000 = 0uA 0001 = 1uA 0010 = 2uA 0011 = 3uA 0100 = 4uA 0101 = 5uA 0110= 6uA 0111 = 7uA 1000 = 8uA 1001= 9uA 1010 = 10uA 1011 = Do not use 1100 = Do not use 1101 = Do not use 1110 = Do not use 1111 = Do not use

Field1.Field_Description: Program LED Current for LED2 signal Use these register bits to specify the LED2 LED current setting for the LED2 LED. The nominal value of LED2 LED current will be = (LED2LED[7:0] / 256) x Full Scale Current where the Full-scale LED2 LED current is either 150mA or 75mA (specified by register bits LED Range<1:0>)

Field2.Field_Description: Program LED Current for LED1 signal Use these register bits to specify the LED current setting for the LED1 LED.The nominal value of LED1 LED current will be = (LED1LED[7:0] / 256) x Full Scale Current where the Full-scale LED current is either 150mA or 75mA (specified by register bits LED Range<1:0>)

Field3.Field_Description: <LED_Range> LED current range for Tx ref V= 0.75V Tx ref V= 0.5V Tx ref V= 1.0V 00 150mA 100mA 200mA 01 75mA 50mA 100mA 10 150mA 100mA 200mA 11 Tx is OFF Tx is OFF Tx is OFF

Field1.Field_Description: Power Down AFE Mode 0 = The AFE is powered up 1 = The entire AFE is powered down (including the Tx, Rx & Diagnostics blocks)

Field2.Field_Description: Power Down Receiver Mode 0 = The Rx is powered up 1 = Only the Rx module is powered down

Field3.Field_Description: Power Down Transmitter Mode 0 = The Tx is powered up 1 = Only the Tx module is powered down

Field4.Field_Description: Program Diagnostics Clock Mode 0 = Fast Diag Mode 1 = Slow Diag Mode

Field5.Field_Description: Crystal Disable Mode 1 = The crystal module is disabled – an external 8MHz clock must be applied to the XIN pin 0 = The crystal module is enabled, requires the 8MHz crystal to be connected to the XIN/XOUT pins

Field6.Field_Description: This bit determines the state of the device digital output pins, including the clock output pin and SPI output pins. In order to avoid loading the SPI bus when multiple devices are connected, this bit must be set to '1' (3-state mode) whenever the device SPI is inactive. 0 = Normal operation (default) 1 = 3-state mode

Field7.Field_Description: Transmitter Bridge Mode 0 = LED Driver is configured as H-Bridge 1 = LED Driver is configured as push-pull

Field8.Field_Description: Enable ADC Bypass Mode 0 = Normal Mode, Internal ADC is active 1 = ADC Bypasss Mode. Analog signal is output to ADC_BYPP and ADC_BYPN Pins

Field9.Field_Description: Reset clock onto PD_ALM pin 0 = Normal mode; no reset clock signal is connected to the PD_ALM pin 1 = Reset clock signal is connected to the PD_ALM pin

Field10.Field_Description: Sets the Transmitter Reference Voltage. This Tx Reference Voltage is available on the device TX_REF Pin. 00 = 0.75V Tx Reference Voltage 01 = 0.5V Tx Reference Voltage 10 = 1.0V Tx Reference Voltage 11 = 0.75V Tx Reference Voltage

Field1.Field_Description: Must always be set to ‘0’
Must always be set to ‘0’
Must always be set to ‘0’
This register is reserved for factory use. Readback values vary between devices.
This register is reserved for factory use. Readback values vary between devices.

Alarm Pin Clock Enable 0 = Disables monitoring of internal clocks – pins PD_ALM, LED_ALM function as diagnostic fault alarm output pins 1 = Enables monitoring of internal clocks – these clocks can be brought out on PD_ALM & LED_ALM selectively (depending on value of register bit Clocks on TP<2:0>).

This register contains the digital value of the latest LED2 sample converted by the ADC. The ADC_RDY signal goes high each time that the contents of this register are updated. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE.

This register contains the digital value of the latest LED2 ambient sample converted by the ADC. The ADC_RDY signal goes high each time that the contents of this register are updated. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE.

This register contains the digital value of the latest LED1 sample converted by the ADC. The ADC_RDY signal goes high each time that the contents of this register are updated. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE.

This register contains the digital value of the latest LED1 ambient sample converted by the ADC. The ADC_RDY signal goes high each time that the contents of this register are updated. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE

This register contains the digital value of the LED2 sample after the LED2 ambient is subtracted [(LED2 – LED2 Ambient) Digital Value]. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE.

This register contains the digital value of the LED1 sample after the LED1 ambient is subtracted from it [(LED1 – LED1 Ambient) Digital Value]. The host processor must readout this register before the next sample is converted by the AFE.
Indicates that INP pin is Short Circuit to LED cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field2.Field_Description: Indicates that INN pin is Short Circuit to LED cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field3.Field_Description: Indicates that INP is Short Circuit to GND cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field4.Field_Description: Indicates that INN is Short Circuit to GND cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field5.Field_Description: Indicates that PD is Short Circuit 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field6.Field_Description: Indicates that PD is Open Circuit 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field7.Field_Description: Indicates that OUTN is Short Circuit TO GND cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field8.Field_Description: Indicates that OUTP is Short Circuit TO GND cable 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field9.Field_Description: Indicates that LED is Short Circuit 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field10.Field_Description: Indicates that LED 2 is Open Circuit 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field11.Field_Description: Indicates that LED 1 is Open Circuit 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field12.Field_Description: LED Alarm Status. Indicates status of LED_ALM (same as LED_ALM pin) 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present

Field13.Field_Description: Photodiode Alarm Status. Indicates status of PD_ALM (same as PD_ALM pin) 0 = No Fault 1 = Fault Present
